revised_title: Synaptic Changes in the Visual System: The Impact of Light and Darkness
tldr: The author investigates the structural changes in synapses in the visual system of rats when exposed to different lighting conditions. They found that rats kept in darkness had larger synaptic profile diameters but lower terminal density compared to those in normal lighting conditions. These changes were reversible and not limited to the visual system, suggesting that light and darkness may have a widespread effect on synaptic structures.
